  • Constructor Details

    • CSVSearcher

      public CSVSearcher(CSVParser parser, String searchTerm, Boolean hasHeaders, String columnIdentifier) throws IOException, FactoryFailureException
      1. "As a user of your command-line program, I should be able to search a CSV file for rows that contain a value I provide in a given column, or all columns.”

      utility program that takes in csv filename, value to search for, and a column identifier the column identifier can be an index or a column name if csv file has column headers (boolean) (may have the user specify whether the csv contains headers) if no column identifier, the search should be performed on all columns

      Should print the rows which contain the given value (in the column of interest if there is one)

      Note: make sure to handle upper, lower, or mismatches if the file cannot be found or opened, or an error is encountered when reading, print an appropriate error message via System.err.println and terminate rather than crashing with an exception (Design) where should these messages be created? should CSV parser class itself be printing to the screen? Consider different possible use-cases

      Throws:
      IOException
      FactoryFailureException
